response.original_title: California Executive Guide: Resolving "CEO Doppelg채nger" Deepfake Phishing
response.overview: California AI Security Helpline: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: In 2026, California's tech sector is seeing a massive surge in "CEO Doppelg채nger" attacks. Technically, these are Multimodal AI Phishing campaigns where an attacker uses a real-time AI-cloned voice and video to impersonate an executive during a Zoom or Teams call. The goal is to trick employees into authorized OAuth Token Export or large wire transfers. Because the attacker uses a "Live" identity, standard signature-based antivirus cannot detect the threat. Advanced Restoration Protocols: Multimodal Audit: Use the 2026 Identity Verification Module to analyze audio-video latency for synthetic artifacts (metallic echoes or frame jitter). Session Token Flush: Immediately revoke all active web sessions to invalidate any "Stolen" OAuth tokens captured during the deepfake interaction. Biometric Lock: Implement a "Hardware Security Key" requirement for any high-value transaction initiated via video call.
